This game is so much fun. I could play this game for hours on end without getting bored. I highly suggest this game to any horror fans, even if you don't play video games that much.

Around a year ago i would have recommended this game, it was pretty fun.
But now there is no way in hell that i could honestly give it a thumbs up review. 
-With every update comes patch for everything they broke, and half of the maps gets disabled.
-Hackers run rampant at higher MMR, and nothing is being done about that
-Suddenly, one of the associated streamers (not the devs) brings up the ddos and doxing problem
-MMR/SBMM is bad, and ruins matchmaking (stop with "grade" stupidity, and bring back "rank" system)
-Balance went out of the window (cause devs are surv mains) and with every new character released surv get better and more unbalanced perks, while killers get mediocre at best, and are encouraged to play scummy (face camp, tunel, etc.) to get even one kill
-And for all the inconveniences, we're being given stupid currency that we get for just playing and they now give out on grade reset every month
So yeah, i can't say this is a good game anymore, and with the way things are looking i'd be worried it's gonna get rundown in a matter of a year or two

Scary and interesting at first, but as you progress and get better the frustration builds up. Enjoyable game but if you play too much it gets on your nerves.

A great game to play with friends. Playing killer can be frustrating bcs of toxic people but killing the toxic guy is always the best feeling. As a survivor a game can be really fun and also boring it depends on the skill of the killer. Looping the beginner killer entire game is fun at first but quickly becomes boring and going down in 30 sec against a guy who has 2000 hours isn't fun either. The problem to an otherwise fun game is that you most likely won't be matched against players with the same skill level. Playing a survivor against a good killer is fun but if your teammates don't know what they are doing you will probably lose even if you played better then the killer. There are also many things you can do to make the game not fun for either side, for example as a survivor you can play full team with the best flashlights to annoy the killer and as a killer you can camp. But even tho it might annoy you that is all a part of the game and can be considered a strategy. Despite all the negatives I still think that it's a geat game it's just that you will rarely experience the peak gameplay against the same skilled players.
